meanings.definition: To cover or coat with sugar.
meanings.sent1: I will sugarcoat the cookies for the party.
meanings.sent2: She likes to sugarcoat her desserts for extra sweetness.
meanings.sent3: The baker decided to sugarcoat the cupcakes with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: The snow seemed to sugarcoat the trees in a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully sugarcoated each pastry with a shiny glaze.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more pleasant or acceptable than it is.
meanings.sent1: He tends to sugarcoat the truth to avoid hurting feelings.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often sugarcoat their promises during campaigns.
meanings.sent3: The salesman tried to sugarcoat the faulty product with false claims.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could sugarcoat any bad news she had to deliver.
meanings.sent5: The movie trailer was designed to sugarcoat the mediocre film.
